name: anki-mcp-server
description: Model Context Protocol server for Anki spaced repetition flashcard application
long_description:
Transform your Anki experience with natural language interaction - like having a private tutor. This MCP server enables AI assistants to interact with Anki, allowing them to explain concepts, make learning more engaging, provide context, and adapt to your learning style. Features include review sessions, deck management, note creation and editing, and more.

Requires Anki with the AnkiConnect plugin installed.

tools.name: sync
tools.description: Sync with AnkiWeb to get latest data and push changes

tools.name: get_due_cards
tools.description: Get cards that are due for review, optionally filtered by deck

tools.name: get_cards
tools.description: Get cards with flexible filtering by state (due, new, learning, suspended, buried) and deck

tools.name: present_card
tools.description: Show a card for review with its question/front side

tools.name: rate_card
tools.description: Rate card performance (Again, Hard, Good, Easy) and schedule next review

tools.name: list_decks
tools.description: Show all available Anki decks with their statistics

tools.name: create_deck
tools.description: Create a new empty deck in Anki. IMPORTANT: This tool ONLY creates an empty deck. DO NOT add cards or notes after creating a deck unless the user EXPLICITLY asks to add them

tools.name: add_note
tools.description: Create new notes with specified fields and tags. IMPORTANT: Only create notes that were explicitly requested by the user

tools.name: add_notes
tools.description: Add multiple notes to Anki in a single batch operation (max 10). Returns detailed results showing which notes succeeded or failed. Supports stopOnFirstError for debugging. IMPORTANT: Only create notes that were explicitly requested by the user

tools.name: find_notes
tools.description: Search for notes using Anki query syntax (deck:, tag:, is:due, etc.)

tools.name: notes_info
tools.description: Get detailed information about notes including fields, tags, and CSS styling

tools.name: update_note_fields
tools.description: Update existing note fields with support for HTML content. IMPORTANT: Only update notes that the user explicitly asked to modify

tools.name: update_notes_fields
tools.description: Update fields for multiple notes in a single batch operation (max 10). Returns detailed results showing which notes succeeded or failed. Supports stopOnFirstError for debugging. IMPORTANT: Only update notes that the user explicitly asked to modify

tools.name: delete_notes
tools.description: Delete notes and all associated cards. CRITICAL: This is destructive and permanent - only delete notes the user explicitly confirmed for deletion

tools.name: model_names
tools.description: List all available note types/models

tools.name: model_field_names
tools.description: Get field names for a specific note type

tools.name: get_tags
tools.description: Get all tags in the Anki collection. Helps discover existing tags before creating notes to prevent duplication

tools.name: model_styling
tools.description: Get CSS styling information for a note type

tools.name: create_model
tools.description: Create a new note type (model) with custom fields, card templates, and CSS styling. Useful for creating specialized models like RTL (Right-to-Left) language models for Hebrew, Arabic, etc.

tools.name: update_model_styling
tools.description: Update the CSS styling for an existing note type. Changes apply to all cards using this model. Useful for adding RTL support or modifying appearance.

tools.name: media_actions
tools.description: Manage Anki media files (audio/images). Actions: storeMediaFile, retrieveMediaFile, getMediaFilesNames, deleteMediaFile. Perfect for workflows like ElevenLabs TTS -> Anki audio flashcards

tools.name: tag_actions
tools.description: Manage tags on Anki notes (max 100 notes per call). Actions: addTags (add tags to notes), removeTags (remove tags from notes), replaceTags (rename a tag), clearUnusedTags (remove orphaned tags). Use get_tags to discover existing tags first

anki_connect_url.title: AnkiConnect URL
anki_connect_url.description: URL of the AnkiConnect server (default: http://localhost:8765)

anki_connect_api_key.title: AnkiConnect API Key
anki_connect_api_key.description: Optional API key if configured in AnkiConnect
